pullrequest.title: Move functions that use TinyXML symbols to private headers

content.raw:
Some further comments: 

 * It seems that the functions are missing doxygen documentation, and the inclusion guards are not compliant with the C++ standard (because they start with an underscore, see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/228783/what-are-the-rules-about-using-an-underscore-in-a-c-identifier ), but given that I just moved the functions I left everything as I found it, let me know if you prefer to fix those issue in this PR. 
 * I did not follow a tic/toc deprecation cycle because I consider this functions part of the private API  that were included in the public headers for an error, not function of public API that are moved to the private API. Going for a proper deprecation cycle would require to fix the `sdf_config.cmake.in`, that is definitely non trivial if the internal version of `TinyXML` is used.
content.html:
Some further comments:

  • It seems that the functions are missing doxygen documentation, and the inclusion guards are not compliant with the C++ standard (because they start with an underscore, see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/228783/what-are-the-rules-about-using-an-underscore-in-a-c-identifier ), but given that I just moved the functions I left everything as I found it, let me know if you prefer to fix those issue in this PR.
  • I did not follow a tic/toc deprecation cycle because I consider this functions part of the private API that were included in the public headers for an error, not function of public API that are moved to the private API. Going for a proper deprecation cycle would require to fix the sdf_config.cmake.in, that is definitely non trivial if the internal version of TinyXML is used.
